STATE OF KERALA THROUGH THE SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE, CHOTTANIKKARA, REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM. 2. BIJUKUMAR s/o. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON 06-12-2017, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: DPS ae) Sheath ered seat Be 2017/KER/49277 Crl.MC.No. 1036 of 2017 () APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' EXHIBITS ANNEXURE 1 THE CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FIRST INFORMATION REPORT DATED 29.07.2016 LODGED IN CRIME NO.620/2016 OF CHOTTANITKKARA POLICE STATION. ANNEXURE 2 THE CERTIFICATE COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT DATED 06.08.2016 SUBMITTED IN CRIME NO.620/2016 OF CHOTTANIKKARA POLICE STATION BEFORE THE JURISDICTIONAL JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, CHOTTANIKKARA, RESPONDENT'S EXHIBITS: NIL TRUE COPY PA TO JUDGE Scl. al or7ieeR/49277 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. Dated this the 6 day of December, 2017 ORDER Petitioner is the accused in C.C.No.640 of 2016 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Chottanikkara for the offences punishable under Sections 294 (b), 341 and 506 (1) of Indian Penal Code, based on Annexure - II final report in Crime No.620 of 2016 of Chottanikkara Police Station. 2. Even though the offence under Section 294 (b) IPC has been alleged, there are no ingredients to invite the said offence. The abusive words allegedly used by the petitioner have not been recorded anywhere in the FIR or in the final report. Matters being so, the said offence incorporated in Annexure -II final report and C.C.No.640 of 2016 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Chottanikkara is liable to be quashed. 3. In respect of the other offences, the present stage is to premature to conclude that the other offences will not s 2017/KER/49277 Cri.M.C. No.1036 of 2017 -2- lie. In the result, Crl.M.C is allowed in part by quashing the offence under Section 294 (b) IPC incorporated in Annexure-II final report and C.C.No.640 of 2016 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Chottanikkara. Sd/- B.KEMAL PASHA JUDGE Scl/06.12.2017
